example[0]: She kept dropping off at her desk.
example[1]: I must have dropped off to sleep.
definition[1]: to take someone or something to a place by car and leave them there on your way to another place
example[2]: Iâ€™ll drop you off on my way home.
definition[2]: to fall to a lower level or amount
example[3]: The number of graduates going into teaching has dropped off sharply.
definition[3]: to become lower in level or amount
example[4]: Sales have dropped off in recent months.
example[5]: With the strong pound, tourism has dropped off.
definition[4]: if there is a drop-off in the amount, level, or number of something, it goes down or becomes less
example[6]: There has been a drop-off in tourism this year.
definition[5]: a delivery, or the place where something is delivered to
example[8]: A truckload carrier takes a full cargo from one point to another, without any intervening pickups or drop-offs.
